Expected prices

If households expect the price of a product to increase in the future, they tend to increase their demand before the price increases.

In South Africa, the petrol price usually changes on the first Wednesday of each month. If the new price is higher, people will try to fill up their cars with petrol before the price increase is implemented. There is thus an increase in the demand for petrol before the expected increase in the price. The demand curve for petrol therefore shifts to the right.
